title.narrative: SOCIAL PROTECTION - POLICY

description.narrative: National social protection system effectively targets the most vulnerable and excluded children., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Economic And Social Policy General, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Public Finance And Local Governance, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, Botswana has quality policies and programmes towards the achievement of the Sustainable Development Goals and targets and national aspirations.

mailing-address.narrative: 1st Floor UN Place(Annex) Matsitama Road P O Box 20678 Gaborone

sector.narrative: Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: National social protection system effectively targets the most vulnerable and excluded children.

description.narrative: UNICEF’s advocacy and effective communication with government counterparts and development partners ensured that a Child Support Grant is being considered as an integral part of the Government’s social protection reform agenda. Wide dissemination of the updated child poverty estimates through the Government and UNICEF online channels contributed to raising awareness about child deprivations and vulnerabilities. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:29/12/2021

title.narrative: Information and reports on child-focused public expenditures (by sector and sub-sector) is available by governments; sectors are health, nutrition, child protection, social protection, WASH and education
